EmailTemplate.name: Q2 CEQ 2013
EmailTemplate.subject: Contractor Engagement Quarterly - Q2 2013
EmailTemplate.textOnly:
Q2 FOCUS: 2013 WORKFORCE TRENDS In the Q2 CEQ, we ask the question: what are the trends affecting the independent workforce in 2013? There are several questions that arise. How will the Affordable Care Act affect consulting? What new cases will set precedents on the misclassification of independent consultants? Will the state unemployment, IRS and DOL ever share the same view on how to test for IC classification?
We are hard at work finding answers to these questions, and this newsletter is full of tools and thoughts to help you make sense of them yourself. Be sure to sign up for our Webinar <http://info.mbopartners.com/Apr30WebinarAffordableCare.html> on April 30th, when I will interview both a legal and an economic expert on the answers to the biggest questions surrounding independent contractor engagement.
Jay Lash
Vice President, Market Strategies Connect with Jay <http://www.linkedin.com/in/jaylash>
FEATURED ARTICLE How MBO is Responding to Current Market Trends Moderated by Jay Lash, VP of Market Strategies, MBO Partners - Enterprise Solutions At MBO Partners, we need to be particularly in sync with the national trends surrounding independent contractor engagement. Our clients look to us as the experts in the field because we analyze the ever-changing American workforce dynamic and apply that analysis to our corporate initiatives. Read more here. <http://www.mboenterprise.com/blog/how-mbo-responding-current-market-trends>
TESTIMONIAL “The success AGS has achieved at a prominent international retail client is greatly augmented by the engagement and vendor qualification expertise of MBO Partners. A reliable and innovative partner on a wide variety of client solutions, MBO enables AGS to more comprehensively improve clients’ risk profiles, increase their services spend visibility, and help control contractor-related costs throughout their organizations.” Laura Kochik Regional Supply Base Manager AGS
CLIENT PERSPECTIVE

1099 RISK TRACKER
Heather Prindle
Director
MBO Partners - Enterprise Solutions
Connect with Heather <http://www.linkedin.com/profile/view?id=12852506&authType=NAME_SEARCH&authToken=A_UJ&locale=en_US&srchid=1357704971366305727321&srchindex=1&srchtotal=3&trk=vsrp_people_res_name&trkInfo=VSRPsearchId%3A1357704971366305727321%2CVSRPtargetId%3A12852506%2CVSRPcmpt%3Aprimary> Recently, the Department of Labor sued two Utah organizations – Decorative Enterprises LLC. and Mountain Builders Inc. – for failure to pay overtime and maintain proper timekeeping records. DOL also sued the principals of the two staffing firms that supplied the workers, and appeared to be party to the crime. Read more here <http://www.mboenterprise.com/blog/legal-tracker-dol-sues-utah-company-over-misclassified-workers>.

FEATURED INDEPENDENT Dave Underhill has always loved to teach. When told that he had a knack for explaining things clearly, this became his professional calling as president of his own corporate training company. In 1993, he took the opportunity to go out on his own. Read Dave's story here <http://www.mbopartners.com/state-of-independence/meet-the-independents-or>.
